js.npmDescription: JavaScript Client API for Kurento Media Server

remoteClasses.name: FaceOverlayFilter
remoteClasses.doc: FaceOverlayFilter interface. This type of :rom:cls:`Filter` detects faces in a video feed. The face is then overlaid with an image.

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: pipeline to which this :rom:cls:`Filter` belons

constructor.doc: FaceOverlayFilter interface. This type of :rom:cls:`Filter` detects faces in a video feed. The face is then overlaid with an image.

methods.name: unsetOverlayedImage
methods.doc: Clear the image to be shown over each detected face. Stops overlaying the faces.

params.name: uri
params.doc: URI where the image is located

params.name: offsetXPercent
params.doc:
the offset applied to the image, from the X coordinate of the detected face upper right corner. A positive value indicates right displacement, while a negative value moves the overlaid image to the left. This offset is specified as a percentage of the face width.

For example, to cover the detected face with the overlaid image, the parameter has to be ``0.0``. Values of ``1.0`` or ``-1.0`` indicate that the image upper right corner will be at the face´s X coord, +- the face´s width.

.. note::

    The parameter name is misleading, the value is not a percent but a ratio

params.name: offsetYPercent
params.doc:
the offset applied to the image, from the Y coordinate of the detected face upper right corner. A positive value indicates up displacement, while a negative value moves the overlaid image down. This offset is specified as a percentage of the face width.

For example, to cover the detected face with the overlaid image, the parameter has to be ``0.0``. Values of ``1.0`` or ``-1.0`` indicate that the image upper right corner will be at the face´s Y coord, +- the face´s width.

.. note::

    The parameter name is misleading, the value is not a percent but a ratio

params.name: widthPercent
params.doc:
proportional width of the overlaid image, relative to the width of the detected face. A value of 1.0 implies that the overlaid image will have the same width as the detected face. Values greater than 1.0 are allowed, while negative values are forbidden.

.. note::

    The parameter name is misleading, the value is not a percent but a ratio

params.name: heightPercent
params.doc:
proportional height of the overlaid image, relative to the height of the detected face. A value of 1.0 implies that the overlaid image will have the same height as the detected face. Values greater than 1.0 are allowed, while negative values are forbidden.

.. note::

    The parameter name is misleading, the value is not a percent but a ratio

methods.name: setOverlayedImage
methods.doc: Sets the image to use as overlay on the detected faces.

remoteClasses.name: GStreamerFilter
remoteClasses.doc:
A generic filter that allows injecting a single GStreamer element.

The current implementation of GStreamerFilter only allows single elements to be injected; one cannot indicate more than one at the same time; use several GStreamerFilters if you need to inject more than one element into the pipeline.

Note that usage of some popular GStreamer elements requires installation of additional packages. For example, overlay elements such as timeoverlay or textoverlay require installation of the gstreamer1.5-x package, which will also install the Pango rendering library.

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the filter belongs

params.name: command
params.doc: String used to instantiate the GStreamer element, as in gst-launch (https://gstreamer.freedesktop.org/documentation/tools/gst-launch.html).

params.name: filterType
params.doc: Sets the filter as Audio, Video, or Autodetect.

properties.name: command
properties.doc: String used to instantiate the GStreamer element, as in gst-launch (https://gstreamer.freedesktop.org/documentation/tools/gst-launch.html).

params.name: propertyName
params.doc: Name of the property that needs to be modified in the GStreamer element.

params.name: propertyValue
params.doc: Value that must be assigned to the property.

methods.name: setElementProperty
methods.doc: Provide a value to one of the GStreamer element's properties.

remoteClasses.name: ImageOverlayFilter
remoteClasses.doc: ImageOverlayFilter interface. This type of :rom:cls:`Filter` draws an image in a configured position over a video feed.

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: pipeline to which this :rom:cls:`Filter` belongs

constructor.doc: ImageOverlayFilter interface. This type of :rom:cls:`Filter` draws an image in a configured position over a video feed.

params.name: id
params.doc: Image ID to be removed

methods.name: removeImage
methods.doc: Remove the image with the given ID.

params.name: id
params.doc: image ID

params.name: uri
params.doc: URI where the image is located

params.name: offsetXPercent
params.doc: Percentage relative to the image width to calculate the X coordinate of the position (left upper corner) [0..1]

params.name: offsetYPercent
params.doc: Percentage relative to the image height to calculate the Y coordinate of the position (left upper corner) [0..1]

params.name: widthPercent
params.doc: Proportional width of the overlaid image, relative to the width of the video [0..1].

params.name: heightPercent
params.doc: Proportional height of the overlaid image, relative to the height of the video [0..1].

params.name: keepAspectRatio
params.doc: Keep the aspect ratio of the original image.

params.name: center
params.doc: If the image doesn't fit in the dimensions, the image will be center into the region defined by height and width.

methods.name: addImage
methods.doc: Add an image to be used as overlay.

remoteClasses.name: ZBarFilter
remoteClasses.doc: This filter detects QR codes in a video feed. When a code is found, the filter raises a :rom:evnt:`CodeFound` event.

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the filter belongs

properties.name: value
properties.doc: value contained in the QR code

events.name: CodeFound
events.doc: Event raised by a :rom:cls:`ZBarFilter` when a code is found in the data being streamed.
